response: *Archibald Russell Johnstone (known as Archie Johnstone) (1896 - 1963): Scottish journalist, hotelier and humanitarian, who defected to the Soviet Union.

Associated with the artists were the Scottish journalist Archie Johnstone and his English writer wife Nancy Johnstone who established a hotel in the old town in 1934, the Casa Johnstone. The building still exists, although it now forms part of a larger hotel complex, the Hotel Don Juan.  At the end of the Spanish Civil War, the Johnstones turned the hotel over to use by refugee children who, shortly before Tossa fell to the Nationalists, the Johnstones piled 70 children into a truck, and drove them to safety in France, being chased throughout by Franco's troops. Johnstone, Nancy, Sombreros are Becoming, (1941: Faber), p 8.

Nancy Joan Johnstone (née Thomas-Peter; 1906 – died in or after 1951) was an English writer, hotelier and humanitarian. Her first husband was Archie Johnstone, a journalist who defected to the Soviet Union.

She married the journalist Archie Johnstone (1896-1963) in 1931.General Registry Office, St George Hanover Square, September 1931 quarter, Vol 1a, page 1338. In 1933 the Johnstones lived at 8 Tudor Mansions, Gondar Gardens, Hampstead. In 1938, despite by then having lived in Spain for four years, they are registered as living at 59 Elm Park Mansions in Chelsea, as they spent three months in England in the summer of 1938.Johnstone, Nancy, ‘’Sombreros are Becoming’’, (1941: Faber), p 16.
